thread.title: Hope Opposition won't disrupt monsoon session: Jaitley
thread.title_full: Hope Opposition won't disrupt monsoon session: Jaitley - Qatar Tribune - First with the news and whats behind it

author: IANS New Delhi With
title: Hope Opposition won't disrupt monsoon session: Jaitley
text:
IANS
New Delhi
With a stormy monsoon session looming large, Finance Minister Arun Jaitley on Thursday said some bills were crucial for the country's growth, and added he hoped the opposition would not disrupt parliament over the Lalit Modi controversy.
"The bills (to amend the Land Acquisition Act, and introduce the Goods and Services Tax) are very crucial for development and I hope no political party takes anti-development position," he said.
He was replying to a question on the possibility of monsoon session getting affected over Congress' demand for resignation of External Affairs Minister Sushma Swaraj and Rajasthan CM Vasundhara Raje over the Lalit Modi issue.
